alert.note: Alert for Grand (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 9:56AM MDT until May 12 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Colorado... Colorado River near Hot Sulphur Springs and west of Granby affecting Grand County. For the Colorado River...including Hot Sulphur Springs...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Colorado River from west of Granby to near Hot Sulphur Springs. * WHEN...From this morning to late this evening. * IMPACTS...At this level, water begins to affect the lowest areas along the river and is out of its banks and into fields in some areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 am the River is at 6.61 feet flowing at 2,229 cfs near Granby - Forecast...The river is expected to remain near to just above action stage and then fall below action stage later this evening. - Action stage is 6.5 feet west of Granby. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet west of Granby. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. this evening at 1000 PM MDT.
